channel.title: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms
channel.description:
Like this. [img]http://i47.tinypic.com/2yu0hvp.png[/img]
But bigger numbers, it takes me like 10 minutes per question just because i have a disability were numbers get jumbled together it makes it really tough. does anyone have better shortcuts/something that can help. I also have trouble figure out multiplication's of number i know how to do it but i tend to use my hands trying to count it out, i can't do that stuff in my head.
This is a basic college course, Just having trouble with this part.

item.title: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

1 + 0 = 1 1/3 = 1/3. 10 isn’t divisible by 3.
1 = 1. 1/3 = 1/3. 1 isn’t divisible by 3.
9 = 9. 9/3 = 3. 9 is divisible by 3.
Get it now?

Read full topic
item.source: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms

item.title: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:4, topic:458675”]If you want to know if a number is divisible by three, add up the numbers and see if it is divisible by 3.
Ex. 102. 1 + 0 + 2 = 3. 3/3 = 1. 102 is divisible by 3.

Ex 11596 1 + 1 + 5 + 9 + 6 = 22. 22/3 = 7 1/3. 11596 is not divisible by 3.

Usually start seeing if the numerator and denominator are both divisible by 2, 3, or 5. Remember that you would have to check all primes though until either the numerator or denominator are prime or they don’t have any common factors besides 1.[/quote]what about 1-10? would it just be 1 / 3 = 1/3?

Read full topic
item.source: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms

item.title: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

If you want to know if a number is divisible by three, add up the numbers and see if it is divisible by 3.
Ex. 102. 1 + 0 + 2 = 3. 3/3 = 1. 102 is divisible by 3.

Ex 11596 1 + 1 + 5 + 9 + 6 = 22. 22/3 = 7 1/3. 11596 is not divisible by 3.

Usually start seeing if the numerator and denominator are both divisible by 2, 3, or 5. Remember that you would have to check all primes though until either the numerator or denominator are prime or they don’t have any common factors besides 1.

Read full topic
item.source: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms

item.title: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

As Jc said:
Try with the with all prime numbers until you get to the square root of the number you want to factorize.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiplying fractions and putting in lowest terms
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

It’s always nice to see if an fraction’s numerator and denominator are both divisible by 2.
